nodes.bodyText: is ThreadLocal serializable? Should StructLikeMap be?

The StructLikeMap is used for locating inserted row's the file/position, pls see here.  We want to write the file/pos into positional files when encountering a delete which will delete the row that has been inserted in same txn.
Here, the StructLikeMap don't have to be serializable. For flink,  we will use the RowDataTaskWriterFactory to construct the IcebergStreamWriter,  we will require the factory to be serializable , the TaskWriter don't have to. So finally the StructLikeMap  also don't have to be serializable.
Comment should be "don't hold a reference to the key".
This can be delegated to the implementation in AbstractMap, since put will automatically wrap the key.

Could you break this method into multiple test cases?
A single long method hides problems because it can only fail once, while a suite of test cases that each focuses on one thing can show more information from a test run.
